pingball.simulation.gadget

Class TriangleBumper

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.simulation.GameObject
      • pingball.simulation.gadget.Gadget
        • pingball.simulation.gadget.TriangleBumper

  • public class TriangleBumper
extends Gadget
    Represents a trianglebumper of size 1x1. The location of this object is relative to the board. It will bounce any object that collides with it. Rep-Invariant: The gridlocation must be in the way that the trianglebumper does not exceed the board when combing with the width/height

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class pingball.simulation.gadget.Gadget

    • Constructor Detail

      • TriangleBumper

        public TriangleBumper(Board board,
              java.lang.String name,
              GridLocation location,
              Gadget.Orientation orientation)
        Creates a triangular bumper
        Parameters:
        board - The Board on which the triangular bumper is.
        name - The name of this bumper.
        location - The location of the top left corner of the bounding square of the triangular bumper.
        orientation - The orientation of the triangular bumper.

    • Method Detail

      • checkRep

        public boolean checkRep()
        Check the rep-invariant of this object
        Returns:
        whether the rep is ok

      • action

        public void action()
        Performs the action of this triangular bumper. Triangle bumpers have no action, so this does nothing.
        Specified by:
        action in class Gadget

      • gridRepresentation

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> gridRepresentation()
        Returns a list of strings for the string representation of the triangular bumper. Grid representation of the triangular bumper is "/" if orientation is 0 or 180, "\\" if orientation is 90 or 270.
        Specified by:
        gridRepresentation in class GameObject
        Returns:
        The grid representation
